p: Species extinctions and population declines have accelerated over recent decades due to habitat destruction, overexploitation, and invasive species ( 1, 2), with cascading effects on ecosystem functions and services as well as human well-being ( 3). Climate change has emerged as another powerful driver of species decline, one whose effects are beginning to intensify. It should lead to shifts in species distributions and rearranged communities ( 4), unless climatic disruption acts as a systemic threat leading to a community collapse ( 5).
